answers.author: Thomas Wieczorek
answers.text:
Michigan has developed a "Cool Cities Initiative" that encouraged downtown development. The website is: http://www.coolcities.com/peopleplaces.html
One of the tool box items that was regularly discussed was paying for improvements in the downtown area, including additional policing. In Ionia, Michigan (for which I was the city manager), we determined an annual amount to compensate for additional patrols which was funded through Tax Increment Financing Districts (TIF). Other overtime for special events was billed as part of licensing (liquor service at the annual fair, for instance).  Auburn Hills, Michigan has used TIF districts to not just recoup the event costs but to also fund public building improvements located in the TIF.

author: Thomas Moton
text: How are other communities recouping the extra police protection and traffic management costs (police staffing) created as a result of downtown nightclubs/bars?  In particular, do you impose a tax/ user fee to recoup the extra financial burden caused by the nightclubs/bars (concentrated) in a downtown area?
title: Recouping law enforcement costs for downtown bars/nightclubs
